author: Special Correspondent
text:
A public interest litigation petition has been filed in the Madras High Court Bench here seeking a direction to City Commissioner of Police to provide armed police protection to the district court campus here besides installing metal detectors, luggage scanners and closed circuit television (CCTV) cameras at vantage points.

The petitioner, S. Muthukumar, an advocate by profession, also sought for a direction to the Home Secretary and Finance Secretary to accord administrative and financial sanction for a security plan and estimate drawn by the Principal District Judge (PDJ) here on March 26 last and forwarded to the State government through the Registrar General of the High Court.

In an affidavit, filed in support of his petition, the petitioner stated to have filed a similar PIL petition after the death of 13 in a bomb blast at Delhi High Court in September 2011. That petition was disposed of by the High Court Bench on September 13, 2011 with a direction to the PDJ to draw a security plan after holding discussions with police and revenue officials.

However, nothing transpired thereafter, the petitioner alleged and pointed out an application made by him under the Right to Information Act, 2005 revealed that the PDJ had convened a meeting only on March 7, last year with respect to strengthening the security on the court campus and submitted a plan as well as the estimate to the HC on March 26, 2015.
title: PIL to increase security on court campus
